website_summaries.verdict: Six HDMI inputs, easy iPod connectivity, and sweet sound quality make the Pioneer VSX-1020-K an excellent midrange AV receiver, although it's missing some minor HDMI features.
pros: can connect an iPod/iPhone directly via USB
cons: One-year warranty (most competitors offer two or more)

customer_reviews.title: She was a fine lady of a receiver for 10 years guess I'll be the last to write a review for this one
customer_reviews.text: After nearly 10 years of use. I'll be retiring this receiver in my home theater setup. The receiver powered a high quality $3,000 5.1 audio setup perfectly. I used this receiver daily for gaming, movies...you name it and never had a problem. Though I did call customer server way back in the day and they were terrible. On the down side you can't update the firmware without taking the receiver in for service, I could never be bothered. A electronic that gave me great performance for so long and without any issues I can't knock. Good bye fine lady.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: The interface was pretty awful.
customer_reviews.text: Never again Pioneer. Can't upgrade the firmware without taking it to a service center... there are not many. After less than two years the unit would just shut itself off. Talked to the service center and can look at it but cost to fix was at least $100. I tried a few different things but ultimately this went in the trash. The interface was pretty awful... For the short period of time that it did work, it did a respectable job. Wont buy a Pioneer Home Receiver ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Travis WIlson

customer_reviews.title: Lasted only 8 months, horrible support
customer_reviews.text: purchased the receiver 8 months ago, 2 channels of the amplifier just blew up. Smoked and receiver indicated amp error. The receiver wasn't even on, the smoking happened during power up. I contacted Pioneer and they directed me to some 3rd party repair center and the support has been horrible by both Pioneer and the 3rd party service center. I haven't been able to watch TV for 2 weeks now and they're waiting on some back ordered part. I wasn't expecting this from a company like Pioneer, but i regret not spending a little more money and go with a brand like Yamaha or Denon.
customer_reviews.author: AF

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic receiver for the price
customer_reviews.text: For the price, you just can't go wrong with this receiver. Plenty of HDMI inputs, a great auto-configure utility, included iPod/iPhone connectivity with on-screen display. I replaced a 5-yeard old Pioneer receiver with no HDMI passthrough and I was looking at other brands but based on all the positive reviews I found for this unit, I decided to get it. I was not disappointed. The only change I made to the settings after running the auto-setup was to give the sub a bit more bass. Other than that, it completely changed the sound of my home theater setup and I was able to take out several cables from my setup and run just one HDMI cable to the TV.
customer_reviews.author: Alberto Dieguez

customer_reviews.title: Extremely impressed!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this receiver to replace a Sony DG820, and the difference is night and day. I primarily upgraded to the 1020 for the OSD and the auto level control (I hate loud commercials!), but I am pleasantly surprised at how much better it is over the Sony. Without making any changes to the default settings, once I set up my speakers, the sound and video were awesome from a Blu-Ray movie on a PS3. I haven't really delved into the various settings yet, but this is by far the best receiver purchase I've ever made! I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: J. King

customer_reviews.title: pioneer vsx-1020-k
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my livingroom tv, movie night, watching dvds. There are all kind of inputs way more than I need. I have a bluray, DVR and 1 set of bookshelf speakers connected. There are a few features I may use bluetooth, usb/IPOD connections. Set up isn't overly complicated. The remote looks formitable and has the ability to control all your devices. I haven't set it up yet. The owners manual is half an inch thick and fairly complicated. The reciever sounds great and upgrades the signal to HD for the regular dvd's.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel S,

customer_reviews.title: 2nd Pioneer Receiver
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this receiver to replace one I bought about five years ago. The picture on my TV would on occasion "blink". I would loose the picture for a few seconds to a total loss. If I turned off the DVR the picture would return. I had replaced both DVRs but the problem continued. I thought that the receiver was at fault, but not so. The new receiver offers many more HDMI inputs so that is very handy. My only dislike is that there is about a 3 second delay between getting sound and a picture.
customer_reviews.author: A. Bernard

customer_reviews.title: I got a lemon
customer_reviews.text: I was able to set up and listen to the receiver for a few hours. It sounded fantastic... almost as if I had a new set of speakers. Video was nice too. The internet radio and iPod audio playback were pretty cool. I attached a satellite TV receiver, blue-ray dvd player, roku, and squeezebox. They all sounded/looked great. The next morning, the receiver would not turn on. There was a flashing blue light and an "amp overheat" message. The receiver just kept turning itself off. I am returning it for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: Manufacture Date is Nov 2010, bought the unit Feb 2011, and unit is DOA on May 2011. No video on screen only audio. Contacted Pioneer to resolve this issue and I need to take it to a service center 45 miles away. So I will UPS this to the service center and who knows if and when I will get it back and if it would be fixed correctly. I would caution anyone considering this receiver, unless you want a $350+ paper weight or door stopper. Never again with Pioneer.
customer_reviews.author: Vulcan

customer_reviews.title: Pioneer VSX-1020-K A/V Receiver Review
customer_reviews.text: I have had this A/V reciver for several months now and I'm very happy with it. Set up was easy, sound quality is very good and video upconverting is excellent on non-Blu-ray disks. I still want to go thru all the features and play some more movies to see what it can do. I bought Yamaha for a number of years but the current reveiws for their receivers were not that good. I have a Pioneer display (Kuro), and Pioneer Blu-ray player so and am very pleased with it all.
customer_reviews.author: Mike in Tulsa

customer_reviews.title: skip this one
customer_reviews.text: We used this receiver for a year and a half without any complaints. Then it started periodically turning off. We brought it in for repair and the cost was about the same as buying a new receiver. We spoke with pioneer but they wouldn't help. Unless you want to buy a receiver every year or so, skip this one.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Laborde

customer_reviews.title: Excellent unit!!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent receiver. The setup is easy and thorough using the provided microphone. It also has the accessory option that can utilize a bluetooth adapter; meaning you can pump music to this thing wirelessly from your iPod. (if you don't want to use the included iPod cable and port) I thought that heat would be an issue with this unit in my entertainment center, but is much cooler than I expected. Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Nels

customer_reviews.title: Overkill lol
customer_reviews.text: More than what I needed but very nice unit, bargain
customer_reviews.author: Ronald B.

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased, Great AVR!
customer_reviews.text: So after reading reviews on many AVR's around the $500 price point I decided to go with the 1020K. Cnet speaks very well of last years model the 1019K and it was an editors choice. After using this for over a month I can say I have no issues with it and I am very happy with my purchase. This unit is very easy to use and "just works". Sound and Picture are A+. Setup was easy. Very high quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Pioneer VSX 1020-K
customer_reviews.text: This unit is absolutely outstanding. I wanted to put a home theater system together but didn't want to spend a ton of money or time doing so. My knowledge of these things is average at best so after doing some online research, I settled on this receiver as the heart of my new system. I couldn't be any happier. The setup was fast and easy. The quality is exceptional. It sounds as well as other receivers costing much more. I would recommend this unit to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Loren

customer_reviews.title: This was my largest purchase on Amazon back in 2011 ...
customer_reviews.text: This was my largest purchase on Amazon back in 2011. This thing has been through dorms, frat houses, and apartments. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Audiophile

customer_reviews.title: Reciever keep shuting down
customer_reviews.text: Some others have written that this occurred for them too. It just started happening to me. I've had it about a year and one half. I have no idea why. It's not running hot, just about every ten min. turn on and off.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Terrence Paul Mulally

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Home Theatre
customer_reviews.text: Just to add my two cents. This has exceeded my expectation so far. I did not have very high expectation for the upconversion features based on previous experience with this in other products but I can honestly say that this makes regular DVDs look awesome! The sound quality is great. The MCACC automated set up worked well for my room/configuration. I can't comment much on reliability because I've only had it for a month but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff C

customer_reviews.title: Firmware update please?!??!
customer_reviews.text: For some reason the HDMi handshaking occasionally causes this unit to freeze up. If you hold down the power button for ten seconds it turns the unit off so that you can turn it back on... resolving the freeze. This happens so infrequently that it's not that bad an issue. I only wish that there was some sort of firmware update to resolve this issue. This unit is amazing otherwise!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua L. Meyer

customer_reviews.title: once you get it going, it's perfect!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I love this receiver> It took me a little while to set it up and once I got it going I was in love> I replaced a 9 year old sony 900series which I loved but it was time to get updated> Video and sound are perfect and compare to a sony str-dn1010 which i ordered and return because of a humming noise> Pioneer vsx-1020 is much better in every aspect! I will recommend this receiver to anyone wanting to have a mid level receiver for less than $400!
customer_reviews.author: Mauricio A. Portillo

customer_reviews.title: Intermittent Audio after 3 years
customer_reviews.text: This AV receiver stopped working after 3 years. The audio is intermittent on HDMI inputs and frequently there is no audio. I will never buy another Pioneer product. This mediocre quality is not only abusive, it's bad for the environment to be dumping appliances like this.
customer_reviews.author: SandyEgo

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for the buck!
customer_reviews.text: Very good value. Especially useful is the IPOD adaptor. Be aware that although this offers Sirius radio, you will need an external (to your house or apartment) in order to receive the signal. That isn't included. I highly recommend this receiver. All experts including the tech guy who installed it were very impressed and couldn't believe the price.
customer_reviews.author: J. Dadurian

customer_reviews.title: Works very well, but headphone jack malfunctioned very early
customer_reviews.text: The headphone jack malfunctioned rather quickly. No other problems in the years I have owned this.
customer_reviews.author: AK

customer_reviews.title: Still in the set up process...
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with the receiver and the sound quality but unfortunately I wasn't fully prepared with all of the proper wiring to get the optimal sound quality that I know this receiver is capable of belting out. It includes everything a home theater enthusiast could ever wish for plus things you might not have thought of!
customer_reviews.author: Mama Twig

customer_reviews.title: Used this unit for past 3 years. It has ...
customer_reviews.text: Used this unit for past 3 years. It has frequent issues as it won't turn ON and had to reset the unit every time. Finally it stopped working completely.
customer_reviews.author: SportingSPIRIT

customer_reviews.title: Does everything I want it to do and more
customer_reviews.text: I bought this receiver to be able to play the latest surround sound formats and to switch HDMI inputs as well as other inputs and to have an A/B sound output. It handles them all and has GUI interface that makes setup easier. The sound is great however I'm still reading about different setups as it very flexible.
customer_reviews.author: James Robert Black

customer_reviews.title: Pioneer vsx 1020
customer_reviews.text: Pioneer VSX-1021-K 7.1 Home Theater Receiver, Glossy Black We used this receiver for a year and a half without any complaints. Then it started periodically turning off. Unless you want to buy a receiver every year or so, skip this one.
customer_reviews.author: RSH

customer_reviews.title: Great AV Receiver for the money
customer_reviews.text: This receiver offers more HDMI and more features than I've seen at this price point. Setup was straightforward. The sound fields were more pleasent to me than for my former Yamaha Receiver that did not have HDMI. You should see the box of wires that are now in the closet. I understand that some brand names produce more ego, but if performance is the goal, do not overlook this Pioneer. Also, please note that I purchased this as an Amazon refurb. The price was great and every indication was that it was a new unit. Probably just an opened box. All accessories had never been opened. Plus the full manf. warranty is in force.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A note for universal remote users
customer_reviews.text: The default setting on this receiver is to allow HDMI control, meaning your TV sends signals to the receiver telling it to power down, etc. If like me you use a universal remote and treat your TV as a mere monitor that's turned off and on, this can result in the receiver doing things you don't want it to. (Like powering down when you switch from DVR to DVD.) So you'll want to turn off HDMI control at Home > System Setup > Other Setup > HDMI Setup > Control. Beyond that, I've been using this receiver for a week and have no complaints about its performance. I'll write a more thorough review when I know more.
customer_reviews.author: vs

customer_reviews.title: Buy this if you only want it to work for a short while.
customer_reviews.text: This sucks. You can view my account to see that I am a verified purchaser and I've bought 3 different receivers from Pioneer - all of them suck so bad and have stopped working for one reason or another that I'll never buy Pioneer again and neither should you. Furthermore, their customer support is horrible.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Hessen

customer_reviews.title: Return due to frequent crashes when playing iPopd
customer_reviews.text: I orderd this receiver mainly due to its popularity in Amazon and built-in iPod cable/support. The set-up was relatively easy, But one week later, the unit will randomly crashes and shutdown when I play music or video from my iPod. Resetting the receiver and changing iPod or iPod cable do not resolve the problem. The sound quality from FM radio is also not good. After talking to Pioneer technician, I have to return the product to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: netter

customer_reviews.title: Nice Receiver
customer_reviews.text: This receiver is pretty awesome. The reason that I didn't give it 5 stars is that the latency between switching sources is a little longer than my ollld onkyo. I don't have any experiences with HDMI switching to know whether it is actually slow or just what should be expected from a receiver switching HDMI sources. The auto speaker adjustment with the microphone is a great starting point for tweaking this little b-word. Took some additional tweaking to get it just right.
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: This is much better than the Samsung unit I returned.
customer_reviews.text: I have a 52 inch 1080P Samsung HDTV so I brought a Samsung HTR to go with it. It had problems with the setup and remote I had to get another remote and then that one broke. That was it I returned it and got the Pioneer VSK-1020. This is a great unit I can use my IPOD Touch with it. It has 6 HDMI ports with one in front good for hooking up your PC. With HDMI I only need three cables to hook everything up. The Sound it great I use the 5.1 format. You have a USB port in front so you can use a flash drive if your friends bring music. I LOVE THIS UNIT.
customer_reviews.author: mrtou58

customer_reviews.title: wasted money!!
customer_reviews.text: burn up, just as the warranty expired! never buying another pioneer, purchased a Yamaha HTR-6060BL 7.1. and now I need a speaker package...any recommendations?
customer_reviews.author: A Charlie brown

customer_reviews.title: Excellent home theatre audio/visual receiver
customer_reviews.text: The Pioneer VSX-1020-K a/v receiver sounds great and provides plenty of flexibility for various speaker configurations. The set up can be done automatically and then tweaked manually if needed, but I found that the automatic settings were just right. And there are two different ways to provide audio to a different room, enabling you to listen to HD television sound in one room and play the radio, CD, MP3 player, etc. in another room at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: William Robert Hall

customer_reviews.title: Less than a year
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for almost a year. It was lightly used and then all the sudden nothing would display through it. Luckily it's under warranty but from reading other reviews it maybe better to get a different unit. I've never had a unit that couldn't make it for a long period my onkyo lasted a long time actually gave it to a buddy and he is still using it.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Sandovall

customer_reviews.title: just what i needed
customer_reviews.text: bought this for my parents setup was quick and easy no problems its an upgrade from the old pioneer receiver they had now everything runs through hdmi and works great less steps to change inputs so for the parents its great highly recommend plus the price is the best around.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Moore

customer_reviews.title: Average
customer_reviews.text: I have had this item for just over a year now. Worked great for the first year but unit is starting to act up. If there is a loud noise or explosion sound, the unit shuts off. This just started happening about two weeks ago. I am unable to turn up past 30 for fear of shutting off in the middle of a movie. I will be contacting Pioneer to see what the issue may be. This is getting very annoying.
customer_reviews.author: DARIN

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: works great...I wish that it linked with my iphone, but only recognizes an ipod
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Oller

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, great sound, nice upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from a 3 year old Yamaha AV reciever and couldnt be happier. This has been running cool even in the wooden tv console its in. Had a bit of trouble setting up to power up and down correctly with my Harmony One remote, but eventually got it though trial and error. I would recommend this due to its smaller size, nice features, easy setup, great sound and so far cool operation.l
customer_reviews.author: TechNoNerd

customer_reviews.title: Excellent receiver!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent receiver once you get past all of the overwhelming options on the remote control. Once you find your ideal settings then it's easy street. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: AlphaSeeker

customer_reviews.title: Awsome sound
customer_reviews.text: You don't know what you are missing until you try this receiver. Noticably richer sound from DVD and Blu-Ray. The remote is configured to operate my other devices so no fumbling for the right remote. Yes remote buttons are a bit small but you get use to them. Setup was fairly straight forward and took a couple of hours. There are a lot of features I have not tried to play with but will check out when I have time. I would recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: dave

customer_reviews.title: Great receiver
customer_reviews.text: Did not appreciate the quality and seamless working of this receiver till I laid hands on my next receiver last month (which is a Denon E400). I wish I had purchased another piece of this model instead of venturing out in the unknown. This is a great unit with every input working the way it should be and the sound quality is extremely good.
customer_reviews.author: Karunesh Singh

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Works great and doesn't get hot like my Onkyo did. Easy to use and setup too...way easier than any other receiver i've used. Get it!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Woodward

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Unit
customer_reviews.text: I purchased and installed this unit a week ago and I am overall satisfied. I have only one disappointment; the Sirius input jack is not compatible with the connectors found in the Sirus Home Tuner Kit or the Sirius Home Docking kit. I have been unsuccessful trying to find an adapter cable to allow connectivity with Sirius devices. Inspite of this one flaw, I am impressed with the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Skeeter290

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY PIONEER
customer_reviews.text: I had this receiver maybe 6 months and it stopped working. Audio worked but it would not deliver any video (tried multiple devices). I called Pioneer and they WOULD NOT honor their 1 year guarantee. Pioneer support was very unfriendly and basically hung up on me. Avoid Pioneer products at all cost. I got a Denon with Airplay :) Unbelievably Amazon DID help me. Amazon provided great customer support and took the unit back and provided a full cash refund. So overall the score is Amazon:1 Pioneer:0
customer_reviews.author: Mallory23

customer_reviews.title: MISSING OF THE REMOTE CONTROL
customer_reviews.text: The remote control was not found inside the box it cannot be fully used. I hope it was an error . Ci did not received thean I expect the remote asp or return the item?
customer_reviews.author: Jeanmarie Ligonde

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: For the money this was the best reciever available. The automatic sound settings worked well and even told me when I had the polarity reversed on the speaker wire. The sound is very good. The video upconverting works well with lower format content. Only gripe(s) I have is the remote (too many buttons, too small buttons, hard to read for an old fart of 49) and the users manual could have been written better.
customer_reviews.author: mebright2

customer_reviews.title: great receiver, with only two minor complaints
customer_reviews.text: not going to repeat what everyone else has already said - a great receiver. My two complaints are - no OSD of volume - I guess I really don't need to see what the volume setting is, or I can look at the receiver as I adjust it, but I'd like to have the option of it being displayed on the monitor. - the USB jack on the front... really? So I can't leave my iPod plugged in all the time without the big white wire snaking across the front of the receiver - would be nice to have one front AND back (front for USB drives perhaps).
customer_reviews.author: Mr T

customer_reviews.title: HTML OUTPUT didn't work out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Can't get HTML Output to work on any of my TV's. Audio works, but no picture - just like others described. Pioneer support is like Ferris Bueller, Bueller, Bueller? Looks like I'm not the only one with the HTML Output failure. Guess I'll go back to Onkyo - Last receiver lasted 8 years before display went out.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Pioneer theater
customer_reviews.text: Took a little while to get it set up but that was just because I tried to do it without following all the directions. After setup and got it going it works great. Love the system.
customer_reviews.author: Sidney Barker

customer_reviews.title: Poor product that lasts only 12 months and 8 days.
customer_reviews.text: It is good receiver when it works. However, after almost exact one year when the factory warranty expired, it stopped working. The receiver automatically shuts down whenever the signal is put through. A $360 mistake.
customer_reviews.author: S. Tang

customer_reviews.title: worked great for 34 days
customer_reviews.text: My Pioneer VSX-1020-K receiver worked perfectly for 34 days and then died. It was too late to send it back to Amazon, so I contacted the manufacturer. They refused to send me a replacement, and instead asked me to bring the unit to their authorized service facility in Concord (about 45 minutes away by car), which is only open weekdays from 8-5. So I can take a day off work, or I can go buy another receiver. Avoid this product/manufacturer!
customer_reviews.author: JFS-Oakland

customer_reviews.title: Good quality/ feature set.
customer_reviews.text: This Product is a great price for the quality and number of features it offers. Also, there is some nice upgradability options I might check out in the future regarding wireless music. My only complaints are a lack of passthrough support and initial setup was not straight forward.
customer_reviews.author: Skdjwisnsnj

customer_reviews.title: BANG FOR THE BUCK
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME UNIT FOR THE MONEY. YOU WILL NEED TO SPEND 'DOUBLE' OR MORE, TO SIGNIFICANTLY IMPROVE OVER THIS UNIT. IF YOU LIKE PIONEER, CHECK OUT "ELITE" SYSTEMS, PIONEER'S TOP OF THE LINE PRODUCTS. I HAVE OWNED "ELITE" FOR YEARS, LOVE IT. THIS LITTLE UNIT JUST WENT IN A BEDROOM HOME THEATER SYSTEM, SO FOR MORE SERIOUS SYSTEMS IN MAIN ROOMS, DEFINITELY GO "ELITE" , WHICH IS STILL GREAT "BANG FOR THE BUCK".
customer_reviews.author: STEVE

customer_reviews.title: Pioneer vsx-1020
customer_reviews.text: Good receiver, although the HDMI inputs went bad within two weeks of delivery. Had to bring it across town to the authorized service dealer. Set up was not nearly as difficult as the horror stories I had been reading, and the auto suround setup feature was fantastic. A little trouble programming the internet radio stations. All in all though, I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: KY Buckeye

customer_reviews.title: Awesome deal!!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: 1. I got it for $200 less than what it was advertised for at Best Buy. 2. Very easy to use and set up. 3. Good video & sound quality. Cons: 1. On-screen ipod interface could be better. Kinda plain. I mated this with a Definitive Technologies 800 series speaker set and this thing rocks! The on-screen setup was super easy. There are a ton of features for audiophiles as well. I'm not an audiophile, but am a bit of a Pioneer brand whore, so I really liked this. I had looked at the comparable Elite model, but for the $360 I paid, I think I got an excellent deal, but may upgrade in the future.

customer_reviews.title: Great!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this receiver for 3 days now and it's AWESOME!!! The set-up was flawless and the functionality is AMAZING! The only problem is the manual - it's a bit hard to understand at times. Besides that; no problems at all! Great for the cost! I'm running a 5.1 set-up right now with no issues. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Barknard

customer_reviews.title: Amazing consumer experience!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome unit! It works great! Looked like it was new. All the pieces were included that were listed. It was well packaged and arrived very quickly!
customer_reviews.author: shannon

customer_reviews.title: Don't Waste your time
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in 2011, it's now a BRICK and Pioneer won't even bother fixing it, the sounds gets totally distorted to the point the speakers are popping and the speaker covers get blown off, I've taken it to be repaired but the same thing, they can't find anything wrong. Now I have to buy another receiver.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Lewis

customer_reviews.title: sweeeeeet
customer_reviews.text: It is a great receiver only wish it had the auto feed back with reciever turned off . But with a unit like this why would u wanna hear the tv speakers ! Love it !
customer_reviews.author: jorge

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: - Bought around mid May, installed about around Spring in 2011. It broke down two times in less than a year. Their designated warranty repair shop takes couple of months to solve the problem,
customer_reviews.author: Satish Dave

customer_reviews.title: Excellent receiver!!
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from a pretty decent Onkyo HTIB 7.1. This Pioneer is excellent. Have listened to games through Xbox 360, Blu-ray on PS3, DirecTV, & Turntable using a pre-amp; all sound great. The MCACC, which is Pioneer's automatic balancing tool works well. One cool trick is to connect a new Apple TV, then use Airplay through the AppleTV to the Pioneer. With the iControlAV app, you can be anywhere in the house or outside (using speaker B) and control the music and volume. I'm very satisfied with this one.
customer_reviews.author: ccath

customer_reviews.title: Pioneer vsx-1020 good buy
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is very good, but when the receiver tries to upconvert 4:3 video it does a terrible job. If it's a widescreen dvd the upconversion is much better. Overall it's a good receiver.
customer_reviews.author: Jarod Spurling

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: Bought unit in October of 2010. Has started shutting off saying amp overheat. I touch the unit and it's cold. I can keep cutting it back on only to have it cut off again. Never again. One question- Why are all the service centers far away from the people who buy these terrible products. The one closest to me is about 30 miles away.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan M

customer_reviews.title: My New Pioneer
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product with outstanding sound qualities and an endless array of features. In fact, you may want to check to see if you need them all. Also, to make installation a lot easier, use HDMI cables!
customer_reviews.author: Spider

customer_reviews.title: a/v receiver
customer_reviews.text: set up was relatively easy and the abundunce of sound fields is more then i expected.i haven't utilized the numerous connections as yet,but those i have work great.the hdmi outlets are more then enough.hopefully i will soon connect the internet radio to see what it has to offer.if your looking for a mid-range a/v receiver with numerous hdmi outlets and soundfields,i believe your money will be well spent.
customer_reviews.author: muggsie

customer_reviews.title: Great buy! Love this receiver
customer_reviews.text: I consider myself a bit of an audiophile and when I purchased this receiver I wasnt expecting it to blow me away, but man did it do just that! I have owned this for about two months and still find myself toying with all the features it offers. The home media connectivity and airplay with apple products and iTunes is amazing! It has enough power for my ht room 20x15 and the attention to detail in the sound is incredible. I am runing Polk audio speakers all around I believe my fronts are monitor series II 70, center is CS2 and surrounds are rm7s (7.1 system). I love it
customer_reviews.author: Rod

customer_reviews.title: Parts missing; Pioneer does not respond to messages;non-existent customer service
customer_reviews.text: The microphone that is supposed to be included in the box is missing. I left two email messages but there is no response from the manufacturer. The phone number listed on their site does not connect. The unit works fine but customer service is non-existent.
customer_reviews.author: Ramesh

customer_reviews.title: Happy Camper )))
customer_reviews.text: Well, I'm very happy with this piece of furniture )))) Of course, I'm kidding )))) I love this machine. I did a lot of research before I bought it. Sound is awesome, period. Quality of manufacturing is outstanding. And internet radio capability doesn't hurt either. Basically, I got what I wanted. VERY happy )))) Sometimes You buy a thing and later on keep thinking - why the hell did I do this??? ))))) Well, in this case, it was quite opposite ))))
customer_reviews.author: V(i)P

customer_reviews.title: Pioneer 1020k
customer_reviews.text: Descent receiver with lots of options but sound quality is not it's best point otherwise you get alot for your money. If you want decent sound quality it's for you if you want excellent sound quality go with the their Elite line.
customer_reviews.author: Justin M. Molnar

customer_reviews.title: Wow - great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace my old unit as it lacked HDMI. This one does it all and sounds great in 5.1 with 7.1 being possible as well. The price was very affordable and this receiver does a great job.
customer_reviews.author: Windsheardon

customer_reviews.title: Pioneer
customer_reviews.text: Unit was all it said it was. Easy setup kinda. It runs all 7 speakers with plenty of power for the room I have it in.. If bigger I would add power. The GUI is a little basic but still a nice feature. Still have yet to figure out all the remote features and the internet radio is nice but not sure where to find more options as you must have the asp addresses. I am very happy about the unit though
customer_reviews.author: Brock

customer_reviews.title: Nice piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: I had an old Pioneer and, since it didn't have the newer decoders, I decided to replace it and choose a. Bad choice. Only worked for 2 years and 1 mo., i.e., end of warranty and of life. :( Since my old Pioneer (from 1994) still works, changed back to Pioneer. I am very happy with this new model and would say it is a great equipment, except for the few remarks below. 1- The user interface could be more friendlier; 2- iPad/iPhone/iAnything connector could be better positioned or have a dock. 3- I would like if it was a little smaller :) Overall, I am pretty happy and recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Jose A. Rodrigues Nt.

customer_reviews.title: Unit HDMI video output failed twice
customer_reviews.text: Surprised because I have had no problems with VSX-1019-AH. This unit ran a month the first time, and two and half months the second time. Both units failed with no HDMI video output but you can hear the audio. Spoke with Pioneer after the first failure, and they suggested there was nothing to do but return the item.
customer_reviews.author: Anand V. Sampath

customer_reviews.title: Pioneer VSX-1020-K 7.1
customer_reviews.text: seems as if unit needs an extra strong input siginal. This requires you to recycle the unit if the siginal even flickers.
customer_reviews.author: rqs

customer_reviews.title: Home theater brain!
customer_reviews.text: I had an older version of the same receiver but needed an upgrade (new TV / Speakers, you know the deal). It is a great introductary receiver.
customer_reviews.author: SM

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for your new HD3D TV
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I have no complaints about the receiver, just one word of caition. Make sure you have a TV with an HDMI input. The receiver can take any sort of input and display it beautifully over the HDMI output. It will up-convert any signal, but will not down-convert. so if you have a component or composit hookup for your TV only then this is a wasted purchase. For me this was just the excuse to get a new TV, and take a sawsall to my 65" rear projection TV. (There was no way I was getting it out of my basement in one piece)
customer_reviews.author: Kowboyy

customer_reviews.title: VSX-1020
customer_reviews.text: I have this unit and I love it works just fine I use the 2 zone feature all the time with either the radio or iPad for music outside and still enjoy what everyone else is doing inside. The sound is really great with my speakers. I really don't have anything bad to say, for the money it very good box. No lie! I'm using Yamaha fronts with JVC surround and an BIC V1220 200w bass. People are impressed when they hear and feel my sounds...
customer_reviews.author: Bashli

customer_reviews.title: Lame. It should just work when you turn it ...
customer_reviews.text: Works OK most of the time but does HDMI input does not connect automatically when you turn it on. You have to cycle through to select the same input over and over until it finally displays on the TV. Lame. It should just work when you turn it on.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Prenter

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Loved the price, this item is hard to find in IL. I like to thank the sender for sending it to me in a timly fashion.
customer_reviews.author: Lamar D Brown

customer_reviews.title: Pioneer VSX-1020-K
customer_reviews.text: After reasearch, you just can't find a better reciever for the money. Because of the way it so accurately calibrates your specific types of speakers to the distance from the microphone (that is supplied), my surround hasn't ever sounded better. Even the learning remote it comes with i found far easier to setup than other learning remotes and its basic setup is very logical. I love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: JDI

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Though I haven't yet had the time to use it (play with it) as much as I'd like, so far this unit has been just what I hoped it would be. I replaced an older unit and was worried the sound quality wouldn't compare well, but I was wrong. For me, the unit was fairly easy to set up and the sound quality is great. For the price, an excellent buy.
customer_reviews.author: finz

customer_reviews.title: HALF DEAD ON ARRIVAL!!
customer_reviews.text: Video looked fine but there was NO AUDIO AT ALL!! Tried everything possible but there was no audio output from ANY source, not even the headphones! We connected the previous model (1019 - slightly bulkier and heavier which we still have) just to check if the connections, speakers, cables, and all outputs work well and everything worked fine. Looking at the number of negative reviews here, it seems like Amazon got a batch with a lot of defective units.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a gift. Love the sound quality. Easy to set up and use. Would recommend this to others
customer_reviews.author: R & R Sloan

customer_reviews.title: Great receiver
customer_reviews.text: This is a good all around receiver. My previous receiver didn't switch video and this one handles the video and audio switching and the sound is great.
customer_reviews.author: SteveK

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I love the 6 HDMI inputs - really offers great connectivity options, and the iPod connection is cool. I have not done the speaker calibration but it still sounds really great especially when compared to my old Pioneer Home theater system, whose speakers I'm still using. I plan to upgrade those as well. The preset sound modes work great. My only problem so far is finding URLs for internet radio streams, you have to enter the precise URL for the online stream to listen to internet radio, which I've not found an easy way to locate. The receiver comes with a few preset URLs, but I listen to only about 3 of them.
customer_reviews.author: TB

customer_reviews.title: What For You...THE  best a/v receiver!
customer_reviews.text: Pioneer VSX-1020K is Cnet's editor's choice award winner..for a reason. Plenty of power, plenty of HDMI connectors, easy set up. Fabulous sound. One complaint, the iPod/iPad app does not work. Not sure why, but worked only once for me. Not a major loss, but would be nice if it actually worked!
customer_reviews.author: BL

customer_reviews.title: Great connectivity, super performance
customer_reviews.text: Have had this for about two years now and still love it. It offers great connectivity, and the audio output is very good.
customer_reviews.author: Abdul Aziz

customer_reviews.title: Dead On Arrival
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed. This unit would not work out of the box. Would not even power on. If this is the quality of a Pioneer product, I'll pass. Returned to seller.
customer_reviews.author: Twin

customer_reviews.title: Died the next day
customer_reviews.text: Set it up one evening, next morning it died. As soon as the amp was switched on, there was this 'Amp Overheat' error and would not do anything. Returned and bought a Denon
customer_reviews.author: Sudhakar P. Upadhyaya

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: The receiver would get a signal from the HDMI inputs. This started 10 months after purchase. It was not repairable. The repair shop indicated that this is a common issue with this receiver. If you buy it from a secondary reseller on Amazon, you will be out of luck as Pioneer will not honor the warranty. And Amazon does not care about you either. Last time I will ever buy an item like this on Amazon. No "brick and mortar store" would treat a customer like this.
customer_reviews.author: Carig J. Brunetto

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love it -- Pioneer has tech support too -- will always purchase Pioneer ...
customer_reviews.author: Norma I. Arias

customer_reviews.title: Solid receiver
customer_reviews.text: This receiver is amazing. I've loaded it with all kinds of devices and wires and bluetooth, etc. It works amazing. It is a true work horse for a home setup! Some people find the remote confusing... at first,but it is actually quite good when you know it. I'm not sure that the new 1021-K is much better, but I'm thrilled with my 1020-K... and will be for many many years to come! Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Ricky T

customer_reviews.title: Great receiver at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this receiver for a few months and I am extremely pleased. I shopped receivers for 6 months prior to making this purchase and I couldn't be happier. The iPhone/iPod dock (included), ease of setup, and great quality sound make this definitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Time2Switch

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product !!!
customer_reviews.text: It is an excellent product, you can plug a lot of devices. The only thing which is weird is that sometimes, it is hung up and I need to unplug the device.
customer_reviews.author: Max from BA

customer_reviews.title: Excellent receiver, well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Compared to the Denon model I had before, this is a much receiver; HDMI input/output works great, sound quality is outstanding; Cant be happier with the purchase
customer_reviews.author: Limin

customer_reviews.title: Quality Receiver
customer_reviews.text: First receiver I've bought. Love being able to connect USB memory stick and start playing music as well as my iPhone. Only problem I've had thus far is how do you get multi-zone to work. I want to watch tv in main room and listen to music in secondary room. How this work?
customer_reviews.author: A. Cannon

customer_reviews.title: Avoid Pioneer products!
customer_reviews.text: Terrible quality. Avoid Pioneer products at all costs. This receiver failed after six years of minimal use. An american made piece of junk!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. Six HDMI inputs, easy iPod connectivity, and sweet sound quality make the Pioneer VSX-1020-K an excellent AV receiver.
customer_reviews.author: LPerla

product_meta.title: Pioneer VSX-1020-K 7.1 Home Theater Receiver (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
product_meta.description:
You're an audio perfectionist. you don't want to compromise your sound, even--perhaps especially--when it comes to your portable digital music. you love the convenience of carrying your favorite tunes everywhere on your iPod or iPhone device, but when you're ready to take out the earbuds, do you really want to settle for the poor performance of a wimpy speaker system? pioneer's audition series is the answer. you don't have to compromise audio quality when it comes to reproducing your digital music files. with its clean, modern styling and rich 2.1-channel sound with a dedicated built-in subwoofer, your portable music has never sounded so good on a compact unit. and with an optional Bluetooth adapter, any one of your portable a2dp profile Bluetooth-enabled audio devices can benefit from the audition series' incredible sound.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Key Features are 110 Watts X 7, 7 Channel Configurable Amplifier, Surround Back. Dolby Pro-logic IIz or B Speaker, Dolby True-HD / DTS-HD Master Audio and Advanced MCACC. It has a 9 Band EQ. Auto Crossover Setting, USB to PC Graphs, PQLS – 2 Channel, Auto Level Control – Multi-Channel, Sound Retriever AIR – Multi- channel. It has a Internet radio. iPod Digital USB / USB Memory Audio. Its iPhone Certified, Sirius Satellite Radio, HDMI Repeater (6 In / 1 out), Analog to HDMI Video Conversion, HDMI to HDMI 1080p Scaler, Component Video (2 in / 1 out), Full Color GUI, iControl pioneer AVR iPhone / iTouch “APP” Multi-Zone A/V Pre-out, Preset Remote Control
feature_bullets: Front USB connectivity provide iPod, touch, and iPhone users ultimate plug-and-play integration of their Apple products with their home theater
Simple connectivity to high-performance HD video, HD audio, portable, internet, wireless, and analog components
The latest version of HDMI inputs and outputs provide more HD connectivity options with "future-proof" 3-D capability
1080p video conversion and upscaling ensures the highest quality video from any source

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars300 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
